COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT This COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT, dated as of June 10, 2009 (the “Effective Date”), is entered into among FOWLER RIDGE WIND FARM LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Fowler I”), BP WIND ENERGY NORTH AMERICA INC., a Virginia corporation (“BP Wind”), FOWLER RIDGE II WIND FARM LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Fowler II”), FOWLER RIDGE III WIND FARM LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Fowler III”), and DOMINION FOWLER RIDGE WIND II, LLC, a Virginia limited liability company (“Dominion”), each of which may be individually referred to as a Co-Owner (a “Co-Owner”) and collectively as Co-Owners (the “Co-Owners”). RECITALS A. BP Wind and its Affiliates, together with the Co-Owners, are developing a wind-powered electric generating facility generally known as the Fowler Ridge Wind Farm (the “Project”) located on certain real property in Benton County and Tippecanoe County, Indiana. The Project is intended to be developed in multiple phases, each of which is or will be owned by a separate project company. B. BP Wind and/or Fowler I, as applicable (i) has assigned to Fowler I certain rights in connection with the development of one phase of the Project in accordance with the Phase I Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, (ii) has assigned to Fowler III certain rights in connection with the development of a third phase of the Project in accordance with the Phase III Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, (iii) BP Wind and Fowler II own certain rights in connection with the development of the second phase (which will be developed in two sub-phases) and (iv) BP Wind owns certain rights in connection with an additional phase of the Project. On the date hereof, BP Wind and Fowler II have begun construction of Phase II. Pursuant to a Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement with Fowler II, BP Wind will assign to Fowler II certain assets and rights related to Phase IIA. C. Simultaneously herewith, BP Wind and Dominion have entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement for the purchase by Dominion of all assets relating to Phase IIB of the Project (the “Phase IIB Purchase Agreement”). Upon Closing (as defined in the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement) of the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement, all rights and obligations of Phase IIB hereunder shall automatically be assigned to Dominion, and Dominion shall accept all rights and obligations with respect to Phase IIB hereunder arising after Closing. If Closing does not occur, BP Wind or its assigns shall continue to be responsible for all rights and obligations relating to Phase IIA and Phase IIB under this Agreement, Dominion shall have no rights or obligations related to Phase IIB hereunder and Dominion shall no longer be a party to this Agreement in accordance with Section 3.2.1. D. The installed nameplate generating capacity of each phase of the Project will be approximately: Phase I: 301.3 MW Phase IIA: 200 MW Phase IIB: 150 MW Phase III: 99 MW Additional Phase: up to 250 MW E. The Co-Owners own or will own undivided interests in certain real and personal property acquired or to be acquired in accordance with their respective Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreements and wish to share the use and cost of certain electrical transmission, operations and maintenance, communications and other facilities and associated real property rights, and to engage the Common Facilities Manager (as hereinafter defined) to repair, manage, operate and maintain the foregoing, all on and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the recitals, the mutual promises in this Agreement, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which the Co-Owners acknowledge, the Co-Owners agree as follows: 1. DEFINITIONS, INTERPRETATION, RECITALS AND EXHIBITS 1.1 Definitions. Except as required by grammatical usage and apart from proper nouns, capitalized terms used herein have the respective meanings set forth below. “Additional Phase” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 3.2.2. “Affiliate” means, with respect to any Co-Owner, any Person directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under common control with such Co-Owner. The term “control” and correlative terms includes the possession, directly or indirectly and whether acting alone or in conjunction with others, of the authority to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract, or otherwise. “Agreement” means this Common Facilities Agreement, all Exhibits and amendments hereto, and all documents incorporated by reference herein. “All-Phases Common Facilities” has the meaning ascribed to it in Exhibit B. “All-Phases Shared Assets” has the meaning ascribed to it in required or authorized to be closed. “Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement” means, as applicable, (a) with respect to Phase I, the Phase I Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, (b) with respect to Phase III, the Phase III Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement or (c) any similar agreement pursuant to which BP Wind assigns an interest in Phase IIA, Phase IIB or the Additional Phase (or a Sub-Phase thereof) to a Person. “Claim” means any and all judgments, claims, causes of action, demands, lawsuits, suits, proceedings, governmental investigations, audits or administrative Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include any information that (x) is publicly available as of the proposed date of disclosure, or that later becomes publicly available, The Incidental Take Permit shall constitute a part of the Shared Assets Group as set forth in Exhibit B hereto. “Indemnified Parties” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 9.4.1. “Indemnifying the meaning ascribed to it in the Recitals. “Proportionate Share” means, as applied with respect to the sharing and allocation of costs, rights, interests, obligations and/or Liabilities related to a Shared Assets Group among two or more Phases with an Undivided Use Interest in the applicable Shared Assets comprising the relevant Shared Assets Group, the proportion a Phase’s installed nameplate capacity connected to such Shared Assets Group bears to the aggregate installed nameplate capacity of all such Phases using such Shared Assets at the time; provided that, for the purpose of such calculation, the installed nameplate capacity of: (1) any Phase that has not yet achieved its Commissioning Date shall be deemed to be 0 MW; and (2) any Phase that has achieved its Commissioning Date shall be deemed to be the portion of the expected nameplate capacity set forth in Recital D that is expected to be connected to such Shared Assets Group. In this Agreement, a reference to a Proportionate Share with respect to a given Co-Owner (unless specifically referring to such Co-Owner’s Proportionate Share in one or more specified Shared Assets Groups or in one or more specified Shared Assets) shall mean the sum of the Proportionate Share of such Co-Owner in each of the Shared Assets Groups in which such Co-Owner has an Undivided Use Interest. Except with respect to the permanent disconnection of a Phase, following the Commissioning Date of such Phase, the Proportionate Share of each Co-Owner in each Shared Assets Group covering such Phase shall not be reduced or adjusted as the result of any casualty to or loss of any of its Wind Turbines, or any reduction of the nameplate generating capacity of any of its Wind Turbines. “Prudent Wind Energy Practices” means any of the practices, methods, equipment, specifications, and standards of care, skill, safety and diligence, as the same may change from time to time, but applied in light of the facts known at the time, as are generally applied or utilized under comparable circumstances by reasonably experienced and prudent professionals in respect of the repair, management, operation and maintenance of wind generating facilities or transmission facilities of comparable type and complexity to the Project or the Shared Assets, as applicable. “Prudent Wind Energy Practices” do not necessarily mean the best practice, method, or standard of care, skill, safety and diligence in all cases, but is instead intended to encompass a range of acceptable practices, methods, and standards. “Replacement Transformer” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 3.3.1. “Representing Party” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 7.1. “Route 41 Switchyard” has the meaning ascribed to it in Exhibit B. “Route 41 Switchyard-to-Phase IIA Substation Transmission Line” means the approximately 3 mile 345 kV transmission line that will run between the Phase IIA Substation and the Route 41 Switchyard, as more particularly depicted in Exhibit B-1, attached hereto and made a part hereof, and which shall not be a Common Facility and shall be owned solely by Phase IIA. “Route 41 Switchyard-to-Phase IIB Substation Transmission Line” means the approximately 3.5-mile 345 kV transmission line that will run between the Phase IIB Substation and the Route 41 Switchyard, as more particularly depicted in Exhibit B-1, attached hereto and made a part hereof, and which shall not be a Common Facility and shall be owned solely by Phase IIB. “SCADA” means supervisory communications and data acquisition equipment. “Shared Assets” means, collectively, the Common Facilities, associated Shared Real Property and the Incidental Take Permit. “Shared Assets Group” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 2.3. “Shared Real Property” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 2.2. “Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer” has the meaning ascribed to it in Exhibit B and, in case of its usage by a Phase hereunder, shall include any replacement thereof provided in accordance with this Agreement. “Sub-Phase” shall mean, (i) with respect to Phase II, each of Phase IIA and Phase IIB, and (ii) with respect to the Additional Phase, a portion of the Additional Phase developed by BP Wind or its assignee, in each case which shall be treated as an individual Phase hereunder. “Tax” means all federal, state, provincial, territorial, municipal, local or foreign income, profits, franchise, gross receipts, environmental (including taxes under Internal Revenue Code § 59A), customs, duties, net worth, sales, use, goods and services, withholding, value added, ad valorem, employment, social security, disability, occupation, pension, real property, personal property (tangible and intangible), stamp, transfer, conveyance, severance, production, excise and other taxes, withholdings, duties, levies, imposts and other similar charges and assessments (including any and all fines, penalties and additions attributable to or otherwise imposed on or with respect to any such taxes, charges, fees, levies or other assessments, and interest thereon) imposed by or on behalf of any Governmental Authority, in each case whether such Tax arises by law, contract or otherwise. “Transfer” means to sell, assign, transfer, convey, give, exchange or otherwise dispose of an interest in tangible or intangible assets, whether such transfer is voluntary, involuntary, by operation of Law, or otherwise. “Transferring Co-Owner” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 11.1. “Undivided Ownership Interest” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 3.1. “Undivided Use Interest” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 3.1. “West Substation” means the electric substation, located on land owned by NOVA 3478 LLC that is subject to Wind Energy Easement Agreement #163, including the perimeter fence around it and all equipment and facilities installed within the perimeter fence of this substation, as more particularly described in Exhibit B-1 attached hereto and made a part hereof, PROVIDED THAT, the West Substation excludes (a) the High Side West Substation equipment, (b) all Medium-Voltage power collection system (including the respective collection lines coming into the West Substation); and (c) electric metering equipment upstream from the High Side West Substation. “Wind Turbine” means a wind turbine generator, including the following components: a tower, a nacelle, turbine blades, control panels, and grounding. 1.2 Interpretation. 1.2.1 References in this Agreement. In this Agreement, unless a clear, contrary intention appears: (a) the singular includes the plural and vice versa; (b) reference to any Person includes such Person’s successors and assigns but, in the case of a Co-Owner, only if such assigns are permitted by this Agreement, and reference to a Person in a particular capacity excludes such Person in any other capacity; (c) reference to any gender includes each other gender; (d) reference to any agreement (including this Agreement), document or instrument means such agreement, document or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof and, if applicable, the terms of this Agreement; (e) reference to any Law means such Law as amended, modified, codified or reenacted, in whole or in part, and in effect from time to time, including, if applicable, rules and regulations promulgated thereunder; (f) reference to any Section means such Section of this Agreement, and references in any Section or definition to any clause means such clause of such Section or definition; (g) “hereunder,” “hereof,” “hereto” and words of similar import shall be deemed references to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Section or other provision of this Agreement; (h) “including” (and with correlative meaning “include”) means including without limiting the generality of any description preceding such term; and (i) relative to the determination of any period of time, “from” means “from and including”, “to” means “to but excluding” and “through” means “through and including”. 1.2.2 Industry Meanings. Words and abbreviations not defined in this Agreement that have well-known technical or wind power industry meanings in the United States are used in this Agreement in accordance with those recognized meanings. 1.2.3 Joint Responsibility for Drafting. This Agreement was negotiated and prepared by the Co-Owners with advice of counsel to the extent deemed necessary by each Co-Owner. The Co-Owners have agreed to the wording of this Agreement, and none of the provisions of this Agreement shall be construed against one Co-Owner on the ground that such Co-Owner is the author of this Agreement or any part of this Agreement. 1.2.4 Incorporation of Recitals and Exhibits. The Recitals set forth in this Agreement and the Exhibits attached hereto are incorporated into this Agreement by reference for all purposes. 2. COMMON FACILITIES AND SHARED REAL PROPERTY. 2.1 Common Facilities; Excluded Facilities. The Co-Owners plan to procure, install, and construct, or have procured, installed and constructed, certain electrical transmission, operations and maintenance, communications and other facilities, as more particularly described in Part I of Exhibit B, which may be altered or reconstructed by amendment in accordance with this Agreement, for common use by the Co-Owners (collectively, the “Common Facilities”). Each grouping of Common Facilities is described in Exhibit B (each, a “Common Facilities Group”). The initial Common Facilities Groups shall be the Phases I/III Common Facilities group, the All-Phases Common Facilities group, the Phase IIA/IIB Common Facilities group, the Phases I/IIA/IIB Common Facilities group, and the Phases I/IIB/III Common Facilities group; provided, that additional Common Facilities Groups may be created in connection with the commissioning of Phase IIA, Phase IIB or the Additional Phase, as described in Section 3.2. The Common Facilities shall not include the following facilities (the “Excluded Facilities”): 2.1.1 Any site access roads built by any Phase; provided that each Phase may use the access roads built by any other Phase, at no cost to the Phase that uses such roads, subject to Section 9.4; 2.1.2 The Medium-Voltage power collection system and electric meters owned by any Phase, even though connected to Common Facilities for such Phase; or 2.1.3 Any other facilities or equipment not described on Exhibit B. 2.2 Shared Real Property; Excluded Real Property. The Common Facilities in each Common Facilities Group are or will be located on certain real property that is subject to the easement, lease, option or fee interests described under the applicable section of Exhibit B in which such Common Facilities Group is described (collectively, the “Shared Real Property”). Any real property right of a Co-Owner that is not Shared Real Property shall be an excluded real property right (the “Excluded Real Property”). Any amounts due under the terms of the Shared Real Property, and any other costs and expenses incurred by the Common Facilities Manager to operate and maintain the Shared Real Property, will be paid by the Common Facilities Manager and shall be reimbursed by the respective Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest in such Shared Real Property as a Shared Expense (as defined in the OandM Agreement) in accordance with the OandM Agreement. 2.3 Shared Assets Groups. Each Common Facilities Group, combined with the Shared Real Property corresponding to the Common Facilities in such Common Facilities Group described under the same section in Exhibit B hereto shall be referred to herein as a “Shared Assets Group” and shall be used by the Co-Owners in accordance with Article 3. The initial Shared Assets Groups shall be the Phases I/III Shared Assets group, the All-Phases Shared Assets group, the Phase IIA/IIB Shared Assets group, the Phases I/IIA/IIB Shared Assets group, and the Phases I/IIB/III Shared Assets group; provided, that additional Shared Assets Groups may be created in connection with the commissioning of Phase IIA, Phase IIB or the Additional Phase, as described in Section 3.2.3. 2.4 Access. Each Co-Owner shall have a non-exclusive right of access (a) to the Common Facilities in which it has an Undivided Ownership Interest as necessary in order to ensure that the Common Facilities remain operational and that the obligations of the Common Facilities Manager are being met and (b) over any Shared Real Property in which such Co-Owner has an Undivided Ownership Interest. Each Co-Owner shall be responsible for not violating the terms and conditions of the Shared Real Property in which it has an Undivided Ownership Interest and, to the extent so informed by the Common Facilities Manager or any other Co-Owner, the terms of any other Shared Real Property. No portion of the Shared Real Property may be terminated, modified or amended by any Co-Owner without the consent of all of the Co-Owners with an Undivided Ownership Interest in such Shared Assets Group. 3. OWNERSHIP AND RIGHT TO USE SHARED ASSETS. 3.1 Undivided Interests. Each Co-Owner, through its respective Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, was conveyed or shall be conveyed, as applicable, an undivided interest, as tenants-in-common, and was or shall be conveyed certain Reserved Rights (as defined in the respective Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreements) in each applicable Shared Assets Group (and in each Shared Asset therein) equal to its share as set forth in Part B of Exhibit B-2, as described in Part II of Exhibit B, in such applicable Shared Assets Group (such undivided interest of each Co-Owner is referred to in this Agreement as the Co-Owner’s “Undivided Ownership Interest”). Each Co-Owner who has an Undivided Ownership Interest in a Shared Assets Group has an undivided right to use the applicable Shared Assets Group equal to its Proportionate Share therein, which right is exercisable upon the Commissioning Date of such Phase by providing written notice to the Common Facilities Manager that the Commissioning Date has occurred, that such Co-Owner has made the payments set forth in Sections 5.4.2 or 5.4.3, as applicable, and that no Event of Default has occurred and is continuing with respect to such Co-Owner (once exercised, such undivided use interest of each Co-Owner is referred to in this Agreement as an “Undivided Use Interest”). Each Co-Owner’s Proportionate Share in each Shared Assets Group is set forth (a) as of the date hereof in Part A of Exhibit B-2 and (b) assuming the Commissioning Dates of Phase I, Phase IIA, Phase IIB and Phase III have all occurred, in Part B of Exhibit B-2, as described in Part II of Exhibit B, which may be revised from time to time by the Co-Owners upon exercise by the Co-Owners whose Phases have not reached their Commissioning Date as of the Effective Date of their right to exercise their Undivided Use Interest in one or more Shared Assets Groups in accordance with this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, each Co-Owner whose Phase has not reached its Commissioning Date as of the date of this Agreement (and, thus, whose Proportionate Share in all Shared Assets Groups is 0%) shall be deemed not to have exercised its Undivided Use Interest in any Shared Assets Group (and, as a result, shall not have the right to vote on matters (except as otherwise set forth herein) or be required to bear costs or expenses related to any Shared Assets Group), but shall have the right to exercise its Undivided Use Interest in and connect to any Shared Assets Group in accordance with this Agreement, including Section 3.2. 3.1.1 Each of Fowler I and Fowler III obtained its Undivided Ownership Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Groups prior to the Effective Date and prior to the date of energization of the transmission Common Facilities. BP Wind currently owns the Undivided Ownership Interest with respect to Phase IIA. As of the date hereof, each of Phase I and Phase III has reached its Commissioning Date, and each of Fowler I and Fowler III is hereby deemed to have exercised its Undivided Use Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Groups. 3.1.2 Within five (5) Business Days after Fowler IIB or the owner of the Additional Phase(s) obtains an Undivided Ownership Interest in accordance with this Section 3.1, such Co-Owner shall provide written notice to the Common Facilities Manager certifying such occurrence. 3.2 Development of Phase II and Additional Phases. 3.2.1 Subdivision of Phase II. Phase IIA and Phase IIB are expected to be developed as separate Phases. BP Wind and Dominion, simultaneously herewith, have entered into the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement. Until the Closing of the transactions contemplated by the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement, BP Wind shall be responsible for all rights, obligations and Liabilities under this Agreement relating to Phase IIB. Upon Closing of the transactions contemplated by the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement, all rights, obligations and Liabilities with respect to Phase IIB hereunder shall automatically be assigned to Dominion, and Dominion hereby accepts all rights and assumes all obligations and Liabilities with respect to Phase IIB hereunder arising after Closing, all as of the date of Closing of the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement, and BP Wind shall automatically be released from all rights, obligations and Liabilities hereunder with respect to Phase IIB arising thereafter; provided that, if the Phase IIB Purchase Agreement is terminated prior to Closing, BP Wind shall continue to be responsible for all rights, obligations and Liabilities relating to Phase IIB under this Agreement, and Dominion shall have no rights or obligations relating to Phase IIB hereunder and shall cease to be a party to this Agreement. BP Wind shall be responsible for all rights, obligations and Liabilities under this Agreement relating to Phase IIA until the execution by Fowler II of the Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement for Phase IIA, and BP Wind shall automatically be released from all rights, obligations and Liabilities hereunder with respect to Phase IIA arising thereafter and Fowler II hereby accepts and assumes all rights, obligations and Liabilities hereunder with respect to Phase IIA. 3.2.2 Additional Phases. BP Wind and its Affiliates shall have the right to build and operate an additional phase with an aggregate installed nameplate capacity not to exceed 250 MW (the “Additional Phase”), to connect such Additional Phase (or such portion of the Additional Phase as may be compatible with the thermal rating of the Dequine Switchyard-to-Fowler Junction Switchyard Transmission Line) to the Common Facilities and to use the Shared Assets specified in Section 3.2.3(a), in each case subject to the provisions of this Agreement and subject to the other Co-Owners’ reasonable requirements, including as to the manner, means and methods in which the Additional Phase connects to the All-Phases Common Facilities. BP Wind may develop such Additional Phase as a single Phase or may divide such Additional Phase into two or more Sub-Phases, in which case each such Sub-Phase shall be treated as a separate Phase. Upon the Commissioning Date of the Additional Phase(s), the owner of such Additional Phase(s), if not already a Co-Owner, shall execute a joinder (the form of which is attached as Exhibit F hereto) and thereupon become a party to this Agreement and the OandM Agreement in accordance with Section 11.1.2, and the Co-Owners shall execute an appropriate amendment to this Agreement to reflect the Undivided Use Interest of the Additional Phase(s) in the applicable Shared Assets Groups. BP Wind shall be responsible for all rights, obligations and Liabilities under this Agreement relating to the Additional Phase(s) until the owner of such Additional Phase(s) becomes a party to this Agreement, after which BP Wind shall have no further responsibility for rights, obligations and Liabilities arising thereafter under this Agreement with respect to such Additional Phase(s). Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, in the event that the Additional Phase connects, uses or is configured with Shared Assets on or before Phase IIB is connected, configured with or uses such Shared Assets and (i) there is insufficient capacity in the Common Facilities for the connection, configuration or use of Phase IIB up to a capacity of 150MW, (ii) the Additional Phase’s configuration, its connection, or its placement of facilities or equipment prevents Phase IIB from using its preferred configuration, its preferred connection, or its preferred placement of facilities or equipment, or (iii) the Additional Phase’s connection, use or configuration results in additional costs to Phase IIB that it would not have borne otherwise, the Additional Phase shall (i) pay the incremental costs, (ii) acquire incremental property and cause the construction of sufficient incremental Common Facilities, or (iii) allow Phase IIB to utilize its preferred configuration, its preferred connection, and its preferred placement of facilities and equipment for the Shared Assets. For example, if the Additional Phase exercises its Undivided Use Interest prior to Phase IIB doing so, it may only connect and use such Shared Assets if it would pay Phase IIB’s incremental costs to connect or use the Shared Assets, including upgrades or design changes, or if there is no capacity (such as transmission line capacity, sufficient property for transmission lines, etc.) to accommodate the use by both Phase IIB and the Additional Phase of the Shared Assets. 3.2.3 Connection to Common Facilities. (a) The Co-Owners acknowledge that the final designs of Phase IIA, Phase IIB and the Additional Phase(s) have not yet been completed. Subject to exercising its Undivided Use Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Groups: (i) with respect to Phase IIA and Phase IIB, the Co-Owners of each such Phase shall have the right to use, subject to compliance with this Agreement, the All-Phases Shared Assets group, the Phase IIA/IIB Shared Assets group, the Phases I/IIA/IIB Shared Assets group, and the Phases I/IIB/III Shared Assets group (with respect to Phase IIB); and (ii) the Co-Owner of the Additional Phase shall have the right to use, subject to compliance with this Agreement and the reasonable requirements of the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest in the applicable Shared Asset Group affected by such matter, including the manner, means and methods, the All-Phases Shared Assets group, the Phases I/IIB/III Shared Assets group and the Fowler Junction Switchyard-to-East Substation Transmission Line. Therefore, the Common Facilities as set forth on Exhibit B are subject to change by an amendment in accordance with this Agreement. The use of any other Common Facilities or Shared Assets Group by any of such Phases shall be as agreed among the Co-Owners of the applicable Shared Assets Group, provided such use complies with this Agreement. (b) When a Phase is being connected to the Common Facilities, the owner of such Phase (i) shall provide a complete description of planned modifications to such Common Facilities and planned outages to the Co-Owners of the other Phases using such Common Facilities at least ninety (90) days in advance of its plans to initiate modification of such Common Facilities (or such shorter time period as agreed by such Co-Owners), (ii) may modify such Common Facilities as necessary with the consent of the Co-Owners of other Phases using such Common Facilities (which such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed), (iii) shall use commercially reasonable efforts to minimize outages of any Phase using such Common Facilities, provided that such outages shall not occur during the months of June, July or August without the prior written consent of the other Co-Owners, in their sole discretion, and (iv) shall compensate such other Co-Owners for any reasonable, documented losses, costs and expenses due to any outage of the Common Facilities during the period of installation. Each of the Co-Owners shall build and operate their facilities using Prudent Wind Energy Practices, to avoid damaging or causing unnecessary outages of any Common Facilities. Each other Co-Owner shall cooperate (at no out-of-pocket cost to such Co-Owner) to the extent reasonably requested in order to facilitate the connection of such Phase to the Common Facilities. Additionally, from and after the date of obtaining its Undivided Ownership Interest and until the Commissioning Date of such Phase, the owner of Phase IIA, the owner of Phase IIB and the owner of the Additional Phase(s) shall have a nonexclusive right to access and use the Common Facilities to the extent reasonably required to achieve its Commissioning Date. (c) Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, the owner of Phase IIA, the owner of Phase IIB or the owner of the Additional Phase, as applicable, shall bear any incremental costs and expenses of modifying and upgrading the applicable existing Common Facilities to accommodate the connection of its Phase. 3.2.4 Wind Interference. In the Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement pursuant to which BP Wind assigns an interest in an Additional Phase to the successor owner thereof, BP Wind shall ensure that such owner shall agree to be bound by wind interference language at least as restrictive as the language set forth in Exhibit C-1 hereto for the benefit of the other Co-Owners. 3.3 Replacement of Original Transformer in East Substation. 3.3.1 Fowler I and Fowler III hereby acknowledge that the Original Transformer was not functional and has been replaced, and Fowler I and Fowler III hereby agree that a mutually acceptable replacement transformer including all appurtenances, foundations, spare parts and associated equipment (the “Replacement Transformer”) has been installed in place of the Original Transformer at the East Substation, and is part of the Phases I/III Common Facilities. Fowler I and Fowler III shall share the costs and expenses of replacing and repairing the Original Transformer in accordance with Section 5.5. 3.3.2 After its repair, the Original Transformer shall be included among the Phases I/IIB/III Common Facilities and shall constitute the Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer, and Fowler I and Fowler III shall keep it as a spare transformer for each of Phase I (for either the West Substation or the East Substation) or Phase III and for each of Phase IIB and the Additional Phase that pays its Proportionate Share of the costs of the Original Transformer (such proration to be based on the Co-Owners’ respective Proportionate Shares in the Phases I/IIB/III Common Facilities). If two or more Phases elect to use the Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer, upon its installation in the Common Facilities the Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer (or other spare transformers that may replace it) so used shall become part of the Shared Assets Group into which such transformer is being installed, and the costs of installation shall be borne solely by the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest in such Shared Assets Group. If any one Phase elects to use the Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer, the costs of installation shall be borne solely by the Phase that has made such election. Such Co-Owner or Co-Owners shall procure, within a commercially reasonable time and at their expense, a replacement transformer that meets the Original Transformer’s technical characteristics or such other characteristics as mutually agreed by the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest in the All-Phases Common Facilities to be delivered to the Common Facilities Manager for storage and kept as the Spare 100 MW Step-Up Transformer in the Phases I/IIB/III Common Facilities. 3.3.3 Until the Replacement Transformer is installed, the operational transformer at the East Substation to which Circuits 5 through 8 are directly connected (the “Functioning Transformer”) shall be used by Phase I and Phase III, provided that Phase I’s generation shall be curtailed, and Phase I shall not have the right to use the Functioning Transformer, to the extent (and for as long as) the combined generation from Phase I and Phase III exceeds the Maximum Capacity. After the Replacement Transformer is installed, in the event one or both transformers at the East Substation fail, the costs and expenses of resolving such problems and the then-operating transformation capacity shall be shared by Phase I and Phase III pro rata based on their respective Proportionate Shares in the Shared Assets Group to which the East Substation belongs. 3.4 OandM Facilities. Each Phase’s OandM Facility shall be an Excluded Facility of such Phase. Each Phase may construct its OandM Facility either (i) on its Excluded Real Property or (ii) with respect to Phase IIA or Phase IIB, on the Phases I/IIA/IIB OandM Site, which shall constitute a Phases I/IIA/IIB Shared Asset; provided, that the owner of such Phase shall bear all costs and expenses of obtaining any additional rights required to construct such Phase’s OandM Facility on the Phases I/IIA/IIB OandM Site.
4. CO-OWNER REPRESENTATIVES; CO-OWNERS COMMITTEE. 4.1 Co-Owner Representatives. The Co-Owner of each Phase shall designate two individuals (each a “Co-Owner Representative”) as representatives with respect to such Phase to serve on the Co-Owners Committee. The initial Co-Owner Representatives are identified on Exhibit E. Any Co-Owner may change its Co-Owner Representatives with respect to such Co-Owner’s Phase at any time and from time to time by providing two (2) Business Days’ written notice to all other Co-Owners, and upon receipt of such notice the Co-Owners shall amend and replace Exhibit E accordingly. 4.2 Establishing the Co-Owners Committee. There is hereby established a committee consisting of the Co-Owner Representatives from each Co-Owner (the “Co-Owners Committee”) to take actions as set forth in this Section which are required of the Co-Owners under this Agreement, including directing the Common Facilities Manager to take action under the OandM Agreement. 4.3 Committee Representatives. Each Co-Owner Representative appointed pursuant to Section 4.1 shall represent such Co-Owner on the Co-Owners Committee and have authority to bind such Co-Owner in all matters concerning this Agreement subject to the provisions of this Section 4.3; provided that no Co-Owner Representative shall have the power to waive or modify any provision of this Agreement on behalf of such Co-Owner solely by virtue of their membership on the Co-Owners Committee. Although each Co-Owner may appoint two Co-Owner Representatives, the Co-Owner Representatives for each Co-Owner shall collectively be entitled to one (1) vote on behalf of such Co-Owner, and unanimous approval of both Co-Owner Representatives of a Co-Owner shall be required in order to bind such Co-Owner. For the avoidance of doubt, if the two representatives of a Co-Owner vote differently on a proposal (i.e., one Co-Owner Representative votes in favor and one votes against) then the one vote on behalf of the Co-Owner shall be deemed to be voted against the proposal. Except as otherwise set forth herein, all decisions of the Co-Owners Committee under this Agreement with respect to a given matter shall be made by the unanimous approval of the Co-Owners with an Undivided Use Interest in the Shared Assets Group(s) affected by such matter. In addition to any other approval rights set forth herein, any material changes or modifications to the Common Facilities, including design changes and upgrades (but excluding scheduled and unscheduled maintenance), shall be approved by the Co-Owners that have an Undivided Ownership Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Group, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. 4.4 Meetings. The Co-Owners Committee shall meet regularly, but not less often than quarterly, at such time and place as may be agreed upon by all the Co-Owner Representatives, and the Co-Owners Committee shall meet at such other times and places as may be requested by any Co-Owner Representative by notice to all other Co-Owner Representatives at least ten (10) days prior to such meeting. Separate meetings may be held as provided herein for those Co-Owner Representatives of the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Group. Co-Owner Representatives may participate in meetings of the Co-Owners Committee in person or by means of conference telephone calls or similar communications during which all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other. Participation in a meeting by means of conference telephone calls or similar communications shall be deemed to constitute presence in person at the meeting. No actions or decisions of the Co-Owners Committee may be taken or made with respect to a Shared Assets Group at any meeting without all Co-Owner Representatives of the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Use Interest or, if applicable, Undivided Ownership Interest, in such Shared Assets Group being present; provided, however, that any Co-Owner Representative may give its written proxy to the other Co-Owner Representative of the Co-Owner to represent and vote on behalf of it as required hereunder. Only Co-Owner Representatives who are entitled to vote on a matter relating to a given Shared Assets Group shall have the right to receive information relating to a proposal relating to such Shared Assets Group which they are requested to consider. 4.5 Actions Without Meeting. Any decisions, approvals and other actions that may be taken at a meeting of the Co-Owners Committee may be taken without a meeting if all Co-Owner Representatives that are entitled to vote on a matter in accordance with Section 4.3 consent thereto in writing. A request for an action of the Co-Owners Committee pursuant to this Section may be made by any Co-Owner Representative, or by the Common Facilities Manager with respect to matters covered by the OandM Agreement, by notice to all other Co-Owner Representatives at least ten (10) days prior to the voting due date requested in such proposal. If, following the receipt of such proposal, a Co-Owner Representative does not vote either in favor of or against a given matter on such proposal by the voting due date set forth in such proposal (or if none is set forth, by the close of business on the tenth (10th) day following the delivery of such proposal), such Co-Owner Representative shall be deemed to have voted against such matter. 4.6 Certain Decisions. Except for certain decisions specifically delegated to the Common Facilities Manager in the OandM Agreement or as otherwise provided in this Agreement, all decisions with respect to the Shared Assets Group shall be made by the applicable Co-Owner Representatives of the Co-Owners having an Undivided Use Interest, or, if applicable, Undivided Ownership Interest, in the applicable Shared Assets Group. 4.7 Disputes. If there is disagreement among the Co-Owners who are required to agree in order for a specific action to be undertaken under this Agreement, including a disagreement on what Co-Owners, are entitled to or shall be required to participate in a specific action to be undertaken under this Agreement (each such Co-Owner, a “Participating Co-Owner” in respect of such action), then such disagreement shall be resolved in accordance with this Section 4.7. 4.7.1 If the Participating Co-Owners cannot amicably resolve such disagreement, and any Co-Owner gives notice to the other Co-Owners that such disagreement has occurred, then any Participating Co-Owner may deem such matter a Dispute and demand that it be resolved it in accordance with Section 11.3. 4.7.2 In the case of technical or operational issues, should the process set forth in Section 11.3.1 not resolve the disagreement within thirty (30) days from the above notice of such disagreement, any Participating Co-Owner may deliver a notice to the other Participating Co-Owners notifying that, despite such Participating Co-Owner’s good faith efforts to resolve the disagreement, a disagreement persists and requesting that it be resolved in accordance with this Section 4.7.2. Upon concurrence of all other Participating Co-Owners, such matter shall be exclusively and finally resolved by determination of an Independent Engineer, and such determination of the Independent Engineer shall be final and binding on the Participating Co-Owners. Each Participating Co-Owner shall cooperate in facilitating a decision by the Independent Engineer. Each Participating Co-Owner shall bear its Proportionate Share of the cost of the Independent Engineer and all of its own costs and expenses related to the resolution of such disagreement (including those of its advisors and Affiliates). 5. COMMON FACILITIES MANAGER; SHARING OF COSTS AND EXPENSES. 5.1 Common Facilities Manager; Management of Construction of Common Facilities. Contemporaneously with the execution of this Agreement, the Co-Owners shall execute and deliver to each other counterparts to the Shared Assets Operation and Maintenance Agreement among the Co-Owners and the Common Facilities Manager (the “OandM Agreement”). Except as expressly provided to the contrary in this Agreement, the Common Facilities Manager shall, on behalf of the Co-Owners, pay all costs, expenses and Liabilities relating to the design, procurement, construction, installation, startup, use, maintenance, repair, inspection and/or decommissioning of all Shared Assets, and each Co-Owner shall reimburse the Common Facilities Manager for its Proportionate Share of expenses, in each case in accordance with this Agreement and the OandM Agreement. Each Co-Owner shall timely and fully discharge its obligations under the OandM Agreement. Design, procurement, construction, installation and startup with respect to any new facilities that are intended to become Common Facilities shall be managed by the Co-Owners of the Phases who will use such Common Facilities and not by the Common Facilities Manager. At the time a newly constructed common facility is placed in service, it shall become a Common Facility and shall be managed by the Common Facilities Manager. 5.2 Sharing of Costs. Except as expressly provided to the contrary in this Agreement, each Co-Owner shall bear in accordance herewith its Proportionate Share in the following costs, expenses and Liabilities for the Shared Assets Groups in which it has an Undivided Use Interest, as such costs are established and approved by the Co-Owners, subject to each Co-Owner’s rights of approval and disapproval as set forth in this Agreement: 5.2.1 Payments to the Common Facilities Manager for operations, maintenance and management services of the applicable Common Facilities in accordance with the OandM Agreement; 5.2.2 Payments to landowners for the Shared Real Property on which such Common Facilities are located, including any one-time payments for land occupied by any substation, any one time payments for the Dequine Switchyard-to-Fowler Junction Switchyard Transmission Line, and reimbursement of the landowners’ real and personal property taxes associated with any substation and the Dequine Switchyard-to-Fowler Junction Switchyard Transmission Line; provided that such costs do not include payments by Fowler I to Fowler Ridge I Land Investments LLC; 5.2.3 (a) Payments for costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) related to or required in connection with the Incidental Take Permit, including but not limited to all costs associated with the application for the Incidental Take Permit, the issuance of the Incidental Take Permit, implementing and maintaining the Incidental Take Permit and the costs and expenses associated with any studies, tests and/or operating or other modifications to the Project resulting from the issuance of the Incidental Take Permit, and (b) litigation costs and environmental compliance costs incurred in connection with ownership, operations, maintenance and management of such Shared Assets (including any costs attributable to compliance with the Incidental Take Permit), except to the extent a Co-Owner is required to indemnify any other Co-Owners for such costs hereunder or under separate agreements between such Co-Owners; 5.2.4 Payments for interconnection studies, agreements and facilities under an Interconnection Agreement, if any, other than payments for system and/or network upgrades which are expected to be reimbursed to the owner of such Phase by a utility; 5.2.5 Costs of temporarily removing any transmission lines or other Common Facilities from service to accommodate the construction, operation or maintenance of any Phase; and 5.2.6 any other costs and expenses approved by the Co-Owners with an Undivided Ownership Interest in the applicable Shared Assets Group. 5.3 Excluded Costs. The Co-Owners shall not be jointly liable for (a) the costs and expenses of initial construction or installation of the Common Facilities (including those described in Section 3.2.3(c)), except the costs and expenses described in Section 5.4, which costs and expenses shall be shared or otherwise paid by the Co-Owners in accordance with Section 5.4, (b) the costs and expenses described in Section 5.5, which costs and expenses shall be shared or otherwise paid by the Co-Owners in accordance with Section 5.5, (c) the cost of construction, repair, operation, maintenance, or any other costs, associated with the Excluded Facilities or Excluded Real Property, or (d) any other costs incurred in connection with the Shared Assets of another Phase prior to sharing the use thereof. No Co-Owner shall be entitled to reimbursement for any costs already paid by such Co-Owner under this Agreement other than as provided in this Article 5. 5.4 Capital Costs. To compensate the other Co-Owners for having borne a disproportionate share of the costs and expenses of design, procurement, construction, installation and/or startup of the Shared Assets, the following reimbursements have been made or shall be made based on the book value as of the end of the most recent month prior to the date the reimbursement payment is made: 5.4.1 On the date hereof, Fowler I and Fowler III have reconciled their sharing of costs incurred in connection with the design, procurement, construction, installation and startup of the All-Phases Shared Assets and the Phases I/III Shared Assets in accordance with their Proportionate Shares as set forth in Part A of Exhibit B-2. 5.4.2 On or before the Commissioning Date of each of Phase IIA and Phase IIB, BP Wind (or the successor owner of each of Phase IIA and Phase IIB) shall reimburse in accordance with this Section 5.4: (a) BP Wind (in lieu of Fowler III) for the amount of the costs and expenses disproportionately borne by Fowler III as will result in each Phase having borne its Proportionate Share of the costs and expenses of design, procurement, construction, installation and/or startup of the All-Phases Common Facilities in each case including payments made in connection with the Shared Real Property included in the respective Shared Assets Groups and payments made to the Interconnection Provider related thereto; and (b) Fowler I for the amount of the costs and expenses disproportionately borne by Fowler I as will result in each Phase having borne its Proportionate Share of the costs and expenses of design, procurement, construction, installation and/or startup of the All-Phases Common Facilities, the Phases I/IIA/IIB Common Facilities, and the Phases I/IIB/III Common Facilities (with respect to Phase IIA), in each case including payments made in connection with the Shared Real Property included in the respective Shared Assets Groups and payments made to the Interconnection Provider related thereto. (c) The owner of Phase IIB shall reimburse Fowler IIA for the amount of the costs and expenses disproportionately borne by Fowler IIA as will result in each Phase having borne its Proportionate Share of the cost and expenses of design, procurement, construction, installation and/or startup of the All-Phases Common Facilities, the Phases I/IIA/IIB Common Facilities, and the Phase IIA/IIB Common Facilities in each case including payments made in connection with the Shared Real Property included in the respective Shared Assets Groups and payments made to the Interconnection Provider related thereto. (d) Fowler IIA shall use commercially reasonable efforts to build the Route 41 Switchyard, Phase II Isolation Equipment and the High Side West Substation-to-Route 41 Switchyard Transmission Line, and the Co-Owner of Phase IIB shall reimburse Fowler IIA on Phase IIB’s Commissioning Date for its Proportionate Share in such Common Facilities in accordance with Section 5.4.2(c). 5.4.3 On or before the Commissioning Date of any Additional Phase(s), BP Wind (or the successor owner of such Additional Phase if it has assumed its rights, obligations and Liabilities hereunder) shall reimburse the other Co-Owners for the amount of costs and expenses disproportionately borne by the other Co-Owners as will result in each Phase having borne its Proportionate Share of the costs and expenses of design, procurement, construction, installation and/or start up of the Shared Assets Groups to which the Additional Phase will connect as provided herein, in each case including payments in connection with the Shared Real Property included in the respective Shared Assets Group(s) and payments made to the Interconnection Provider related thereto; provided, that reimbursement for costs and expenses under this Section 5.4.3 in respect of the Proportionate Share of Phase III shall be paid to BP Wind in lieu of Fowler III. 5.4.4 The Co-Owners acknowledge that Phase II will, and the Additional Phase may, be constructed in two or more Sub-Phases. With respect to Phase II, or with respect to the Additional Phase if it is constructed in two or more Sub-Phases, the reimbursement described in Sections 5.4.2 and 5.4.3 shall occur on or before the Commissioning Date of each such Sub-Phase being built based on the Proportionate Share of each such Sub-Phase. 5.5 Costs and Expenses of Replacement of Original Transformer. Fowler I and Fowler III shall share the costs and expenses of the Replacement Transformer on the terms and conditions set forth in this Section 5.5: 5.5.1 Fowler I shall lead (i) the acquisition and delivery of the Replacement Transformer, (ii) the installation of the Replacement Transformer and (iii) the repair and return of the Original Transformer, in each case at Fowler I’s initial cost and expense on behalf of and in the name of Fowler I and Fowler III. Fowler III shall reimburse Fowler I for the following, in each case only to the extent not covered by insurance proceeds paid to Fowler I and/or Fowler III by its, or if applicable Fowler III’s, insurance policy: (a) twenty-five percent (25%) of the costs and expenses of the acquisition and delivery of the Replacement Transformer, excluding interest on the funds used by Fowler I, except as provided in the penultimate sentence of Section 5.5.2; (b) fifty percent (50%) of the costs and expenses of installation of the Replacement Transformer, excluding interest on the funds used by Fowler I, except as provided in the penultimate sentence of Section 5.5.2; (c) fifty percent (50%) of the cost and expenses of repair and return delivery of the Original Transformer, excluding interest on the funds used by Fowler I, except as provided in the penultimate sentence of Section 5.5.2; and (d) fifty percent (50%) of revenues and production tax credits that Fowler I would have received under applicable PPAs between Fowler I and its offtakers for electricity that Phase I would have generated under the then-current wind conditions from its then-available wind turbines (as the concept is defined in the applicable PPA) during each period of time when Phase I was curtailed under the first sentence of Section 3.3.3 solely due to the Functioning Transformer reaching Maximum Capacity; provided, that neither Fowler III nor Fowler I shall be required to reimburse the other for any lost revenue to the extent caused by a need to de-energize the Functioning Transformer as mutually agreed by Fowler I and Fowler III. 5.5.2 Fowler III shall make payments that are due and payable to Fowler I in accordance with this Section 5.5 (if any) within thirty (30) days from receiving Fowler I’s itemized and properly substantiated invoice following the earlier to occur of (a) both Fowler I and Fowler III having finally settled their respective insurance claims described in Section 5.5.3 and having received proceeds (if any) thereunder, or (b) November 30, 2009, even if Fowler I and/or Fowler III have not finally settled said insurance claims and/or received proceeds (if any) thereunder, in which case the insurance proceeds actually received by Fowler I and Fowler III as of November 30, 2009 shall be appropriately taken into account in calculating payments due hereunder. If Fowler III fails to make a payment when due in accordance with this Section 5.5, and such non-payment has not been rectified by December 31, 2009, then in addition to any other remedies Fowler I may have by contract, law or equity, Fowler III shall pay all amounts due under this Section 5.5 in full together with interest on the unpaid amount for the period from December 31, 2009, until fully paid, at the rate equal to the Prime Rate plus twelve percent (12%) or the maximum interest rate permitted by applicable Law, whichever is lower. If, following a payment by Fowler III hereunder, Fowler I recovers insurance proceeds related to the claims described in Section 5.5.3 or receives a refund of costs and expenses for which Fowler III has compensated Fowler I under this Section 5.5, Fowler I shall within thirty (30) days give notice thereof to Fowler III and refund such portion of such proceeds or refund to Fowler III as shall result in each of Fowler I and Fowler III having borne its Proportionate Share of costs and expenses described in this Section 5.5. 5.5.3 To the extent possible under the applicable insurance policies, Fowler I and Fowler III shall file insurance claims for (a) the recovery of the cost and expenses of acquisition, delivery and installation of the Replacement Transformer, (b) for the repair and return delivery of the Original Transformer and (c) business interruption claims and similar claims for lost revenues associated with the failure of the Original Transformer. 5.6 Non-Payment. If any Co-Owner (a “Non-Paying Party”) fails to timely make any required payment of amounts due under this Article 5 (other than payments set forth in Section 5.5 and to the extent of payments covered thereby), any other Co-Owner may make such payment on behalf of such Non-Paying Party, and the amount so paid shall be immediately due and payable, upon written notice, from the Non-Paying Party to such other Co-Owner, together with interest from the date paid until paid to such other Co-Owner at the Late Payment Rate. Such remedy shall be in addition to the right of such other Co-Owner to pursue any other remedies that may be available to it under applicable Law or this Agreement. 5.7 Excluded Liabilities. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement or other written agreements that may exist among the Co-Owners, each Co-Owner shall be solely responsible for all expenses and other Liabilities relating to the acquisition, design, installation, construction, use, operation, management, maintenance and repair of its Phase and its respective Excluded Facilities and Excluded Real Property; provided, however, this provision shall not give rise to any rights of indemnification under this Agreement except to the extent of indemnification provided hereunder for failure to make payments for Liabilities for a Shared Assets Group as required pursuant to this Article 5. 6. USE OF SHARED ASSETS; RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF CO-OWNERS. 6.1 Use. Subject to the other requirements of this Agreement and payment under Article 5, once a Co-Owner exercises its Undivided Use Interest in one or more Shared Assets Groups, such Co-Owner shall have the right to use the Shared Assets to the extent of the Co-Owner’s Proportionate Share in such Shared Assets Groups, including, to the extent applicable, the capacity of the Common Facilities to transmit power bi-directionally from and to the Phase owned or controlled by such Co-Owner in an amount up to its applicable Proportionate Share not to exceed 1,000 MW in the aggregate, without the consent of the Co-Owners who have an Undivided Ownership Interest in such Shared Assets Groups. Notwithstanding the foregoing: 6.1.1 No Co-Owner shall have the right to use the Common Facilities to transmit electricity in an amount in excess of its individual interconnection rights in MW set forth in the Interconnection Agreement of such Co-Owner’s Phase. 6.1.2 No Co-Owner may increase the installed nameplate generating capacity of its Phase above, or use the Common Facilities in excess of, the MW amount set forth in the Recitals hereof for such Co-Owner’s Phase. 6.1.3 No Co-Owner shall use the Shared Assets in connection with any electric generating facilities other than its respective Phase. 6.1.4 Except as otherwise set forth in this Agreement and in each Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, each Co-Owner’s use of the Shared Assets shall not in any way materially interfere with the use and enjoyment by the other Co-Owners of their respective rights in such Shared Assets or other rights arising under this Agreement. 6.1.5 The Co-Owners acknowledge and agree to be bound by the following, as applicable: (a) The wind interference provisions affecting Phase I, which are set forth on Exhibit C-1. (b) The wind interference provisions affecting Phase IIA, which are set forth on Exhibit C-2. (c) The wind interference provisions affecting Phase IIB, which are set forth on Exhibit C-3. (d) The wind interference provisions affecting Phase III, which are set forth on Exhibit C-4. 6.1.6 Each of the Co-Owners hereby acknowledges that, in accordance with Section 5.2 of such Co-Owner’s Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreement, BP Wind has assigned and conveyed or will assign and convey to such Co-Owner, and such Co-Owner has assumed or will assume, as successor to BP Wind, all of BP Wind’s obligations to comply with the “WTG Siting Limitations” set forth in Section 1.7(a) and (b) of the respective Capital Contribution and Buildout Agreements, as of the date set forth therein. 6.2 Collateral Assignments; Financing and Regulatory Cooperation. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, and in no way limiting the provisions of Section 11.4, the Co-Owners agree that any Co-Owner may at any time pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, or grant a security interest or other Lien in its own Undivided Ownership Interest or Undivided Use Interest in one or more Shared Assets Groups and in its rights under this Agreement to any Lender to secure Co-Owner Financing of such Co-Owner. Each Co-Owner shall use commercially reasonable efforts to incorporate into its Co-Owner Financing provisions to the effect that, to the extent an alleged default by such Co-Owner under this Agreement may trigger a default under its Co-Owner Financing giving rise to Lender remedies with respect to this Agreement, each other Co-Owner shall have the right to cure such alleged default in accordance with Section 9.2.1 of this Agreement during the period from the occurrence of such alleged default until at least 15 days after the expiration of the cure period applicable to such defaulting Co-Owner under the Co-Owner Financing provisions. Each defaulting Co-Owner shall provide notice of each such alleged default to the other Co-Owners. Upon reasonable request of a Co-Owner, each other Co-Owner shall cooperate in such Co-Owner Financing or credit or any refinancing thereof, including the execution of estoppels, consents and other similar agreements with respect to the collateral assignment as may be reasonably requested by the requesting Co-Owner or its Lenders, and in the making of any filings reasonably required by such requesting Co-Owner for regulatory compliance, which are customary for comparable transactions and consistent with the terms hereof, all solely at the expense of the requesting Co-Owner and at no out-of pocket costs to any other Co-Owner. Nothing herein shall prevent a Co-Owner from intervening in any regulatory proceedings and preserving its rights. 6.3 Interconnection. Each Co-Owner shall be solely responsible for securing for its own benefit, and for maintaining, such rights as are necessary to interconnect its Phase with the transmission and interconnection system of the Interconnection Provider and to deliver the electrical energy generated by its Phase to the applicable point(s) of connection to the Common Facilities; provided, that each Co-Owner shall cooperate to secure and maintain all rights necessary to interconnect each Phase with the Interconnection Provider at the Point of Interconnection. Each Co-Owner shall comply with all applicable requirements of the Interconnection Provider, including settlement of nodal costs. Each Co-Owner shall give the other Co-Owners a copy of any written notice it gives to, or receives from, PJM with respect to material modifications to PJM operations or facilities. 6.4 Co-Owners’ Insurance Requirements. 6.4.1 For the duration of this Agreement, upon the agreement of each of the Co-Owners, one Co-Owner (the “Designated Co-Owner”) shall procure property and liability insurance policies for the Shared Assets on behalf of all Co-Owners as described in Exhibit A (the “Co-Owner Insurance”), and the Co-Owners shall bear responsibility for premiums and deductibles therefor based on their Proportionate Shares in each of the Shared Assets Groups. The owners of each Phase shall waive claims against the other Phases (and the owners thereof) with an Undivided Ownership Interest in the same Shared Assets Groups for matters that would be covered by an “all-risks” property insurance policy and cause their insurers to waive rights of subrogation; provided that the foregoing waiver shall not be deemed a waiver by any owner of claims related to the failure of any other owner to maintain an insurance policy required by this Agreement. 6.4.2 The Designated Co-Owner shall provide the other Co-Owners with insurance certificates reasonably acceptable to the other Co-Owners evidencing that insurance coverages are in compliance with this Agreement. All Co-Owner Insurance and certificates shall (a) name each of the other Co-Owners as an additional insured under the Commercial General Liability, Automobile Liability and Umbrella Liability Policies and (b) provide a waiver of any rights of subrogation against each of the other Co-Owners. All Co-Owner Insurance shall be written with insurers that the other Co-Owners, in their reasonable discretion, deem acceptable (such acceptance shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Such policies shall be written on an occurrence basis, except as provided in Section 6.4.3. Co-Owner Insurance shall provide that it will be primary in all instances regardless of like coverages, if any, carried by such other Co-Owners. No Co-Owner’s liability under this Agreement is limited to the amount of insurance coverage required herein by virtue of this Section 6.4. 6.4.3 In the event that any insurance as required herein is commercially available only on a “claims-made” basis, such insurance shall provide for a retroactive date not later than the date of this Agreement and such insurance shall be maintained by a Co-Owner, with a retroactive date not later than the retroactive date required above, for a minimum of five (5) years after the term hereof. If any insurance required to be maintained by a Co-Owner hereunder ceases to be available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market, such Co-Owner shall provide written notice to the other Co-Owners, accompanied by a certificate from an independent insurance advisor of recognized national standing, certifying that such insurance is not available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market for electric facilities of similar type, geographic location and design. Upon receipt of such notice, such first-mentioned Co-Owner shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain other insurance that would provide comparable protection against the risk to be insured, and the other Co-Owners shall not unreasonably withhold consent to modify or waive such requirement. 6.5 No Waste or Nuisance; Maintenance; No Interference. No Co-Owner shall use or permit the use of the Shared Assets in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would materially increase the premium, or materially jeopardize the issuance or maintenance, of any insurance policy of any Co-Owner relating to the Shared Assets. 6.6 Liens. Subject to Section 6.2, no Co-Owner shall create, permit or suffer to exist by, through or under such Co-Owner or such Co-Owner’s Affiliates and its and their respective directors, managers, officers, shareholders, partners, members, employees, contractors, agents and representatives, any Liens on the Shared Assets or on the Undivided Ownership Interests or Undivided Use Interest, Excluded Facilities or Excluded Real Property of another Co-Owner, except for (a) Liens for Taxes that are not yet delinquent or are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, and (b) carriers’, warehouseman’s, mechanics’, materialmen’s, repairmen’s or other like Liens, that arise from the construction, reconstruction, ownership or operation of such Shared Assets; provided that if any mechanics’ liens or similar liens attach to the Shared Assets, the Co-Owner performing or contracting or causing the engagement of the holder of such attached Lien shall, within thirty (30) days after it receives notice of the filing, either bond around such Lien or establish appropriate reserves therefor, or otherwise remove such Lien from such Shared Assets pursuant to applicable Law (each of (a) and (b), a “Permitted Lien”). Any Co-Owner that violates this Section 6.6 shall take prompt steps to discharge any Lien (other than Permitted Liens). If such Co-Owner fails to discharge promptly any Lien (other than Permitted Liens), any other Co-Owner shall have the right to notify the Co-Owner in writing and to take any reasonable action to satisfy, defend, settle or otherwise remove or stay such unpermitted Lien at such Co-Owner’s expense, in addition to any other remedies available under this Agreement, at law or in equity. 6.7 No Public Access. The Co-Owners agree that there shall be no general public access to any Shared Assets. The Co-Owners undertake to cooperate in enforcing such requirement for limiting access, including establishing and enforcing procedures for security. 6.8 No Dedication of Property. Each Co-Owner agrees that (a) by the Co-Owner’s performance of its obligations under this Agreement, no Co-Owner dedicates to public or quasi public use or purpose any of the Shared Assets or other facilities which are the subject of this Agreement, and (b) the execution of this Agreement shall not, nor shall any performance or partial performance of this Agreement, be or ever be deemed, asserted or urged by the Co-Owner to be a dedication to public or quasi public use of the Shared Assets, or any Excluded Facilities of the other Co-Owners. 6.9 Metering Protocol. Each Co-Owner shall comply with the Metering Protocol. 6.10 Shared Real Property. Each Co-Owner shall comply with the terms of its Shared Real Property. Each of the Co-Owners shall provide a copy of any notice of default with respect to the Shared Real Property that is received by it to the other Co-Owners who have an Undivided Ownership Interest in such Shared Real Property within twenty-four (24) hours of receiving such notice of default, regardless of the party or the contract that is alleged to be in default in the notice. 6.11 Sharing of Wind Data. Each Co-Owner shall share with all other Co-Owners its current and historical unprocessed wind data collected from meteorological towers located within its Phase. The sharing Co-Owner makes no representation or warranty, express or implied, and shall have no Liability with respect to the wind data so provided, whether for completeness, accuracy or otherwise. The receiving Co-Owner shall maintain the confidentiality of the wind data received in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement. The receiving Co-Owner may use such wind data only in connection with the operation of its Phase and this Agreement. 6.12 Standards of Performance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement to the contrary, each Co-Owner shall perform its obligations under this Agreement in accordance with (a) all applicable Laws, (b) Prudent Wind Energy Practices, (c) the terms and conditions of its Interconnection Agreement, and all applicable requirements of the Interconnection Provider (including settlement of nodal costs) and (d) the terms and conditions of the Shared Real Property. 6.13 Relationship of the Co-Owners. Except as otherwise expressly set forth in this Agreement, the rights, duties, obligations and Liabilities of the Co-Owners under this Agreement shall be several and individual to the extent of each Co-Owner’s Undivided Use Interest, and not joint or collective, and no Co-Owner shall be responsible for the default of any other Co-Owner under this Agreement. It is not the intention of the Co-Owners to create, nor shall this Agreement be deemed to create, any partnership, agency, joint venture or trust, or to authorize any Co-Owner to act as an agent, servant or employee for any other Co-Owner. Each Co-Owner hereby covenants and agrees not to hold itself out in any manner for any purpose as a partner or agent of the other Co-Owners. 6.14 Reporting as Direct Owners and Not a Partnership. The Co-Owners hereby agree to elect under Section 761 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, (the “Code”) to be excluded from the provisions of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Code, with respect to the Shared Assets and to make any corresponding election that may be required for state or local income tax purposes. The Common Facilities Manager shall make the election on behalf of the Co-Owners in the manner prescribed by Treasury Regulation Section 1.761-2(b)(2)(i), effective for the period commencing with the execution of this Agreement. Each Co-Owner hereby covenants and agrees to report on its federal, state and local income tax returns all items of income, deduction and credits which result from its Undivided Ownership Interest or Undivided Use Interest in the Shared Assets. All such reporting and any tax positions taken with any taxing authority shall be consistent with the exclusion of the Co-Owners from Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Code. Further, each Co-Owner covenants and agrees not to notify the Commissioner of Internal Revenue (the “Commissioner”) that it desires that Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Code apply to the Co-Owners. 6.15 Cooperation and Compliance with Incidental Take Permit. From time to time after an Incidental Take Permit is granted with respect to the Project, each Co-Owner, to the extent commercially reasonable, agrees to execute and deliver any instruments and documents, and to take such other actions as may be necessary or reasonably requested by the other Co-Owners, in order to give full effect to the Incidental Take Permit with respect to all Phases and to ensure each Co-Owner has the right to the undivided use of the Incidental Take Permit equal to each Co-Owner’s Proportionate Share. In addition, each Co-Owner shall comply with the terms of the Incidental Take Permit, as applicable to its Phase of the Project and shall immediately notify the other Co-Owners and the Common Facilities Manager if it has reason to believe that a violation of the Incidental Take Permit has occurred or is occurring as to any Phase. Each of the Co-Owners shall provide a copy of any notice of default or violation received by it with respect to the Incidental Take Permit to the other Co-Owners and the Common Facilities Manager within twenty-four (24) hours of receiving such notice of default or violation. 7. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. 7.1 Representations and Warranties. Each Co-Owner (the “Representing Party”) represents and warrants to each other Co-Owner that: (a) the Representing Party is a legal entity, duly formed and validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the state of its formation, (b) the Representing Party has the full power and authority to execute, deliver and perform this Agreement and to carry out the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; (c) the execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Representing Party and the carrying out by the Representing Party of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement have been duly authorized by all requisite entity action, and this Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by the Representing Party and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of the Representing Party, enforceable against the Representing Party in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, except to the extent that enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or other similar Laws generally affecting creditors’ rights and by equitable principles regardless of whether enforcement is sought in equity or at law; (d) except for Governmental Approvals in connection with the development, construction, start-up, commissioning, testing, management, operation and maintenance of the Shared Assets that shall be obtained in the ordinary course when required, no authorization, consent, notice to or registration or filing with any Governmental Authority is required for the execution and delivery of this Agreement; (e) none of the execution, delivery and performance by the Representing Party of this Agreement conflicts with or will result in a breach or violation of any Law, contract or instrument to which the Representing Party is a party or is bound; and (f) there are no proceedings by or before any Governmental Authority, now pending or (to the knowledge of the Representing Party) threatened, that if adversely determined could have a material adverse effect on the Representing Party’s ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement. 7.2 Exclusivity of Warranties. THE WARRANTIES PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE EXCLUSIVE, AND NO OTHER WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER STATUTORY, EXPRESS, OR IMPLIED (INCLUDING ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE) SHALL APPLY, AND ALL SUCH WARRANTIES ARE HEREBY DISCLAIMED. 8. CONFIDENTIALITY. 8.1 Confidentiality. Each Co-Owner shall keep the Confidential Information strictly confidential and shall not sell, trade, publish or otherwise disclose all or part of the same to any Person in any manner whatsoever without the prior written consent of the other Co-Owners, except as expressly permitted in this Agreement. Each Co-Owner shall have the right to disclose the Confidential Information without prior written consent of the other Co-Owners: 8.1.1 to its directors, officers, employees, advisors, counsel, public accountants, agents, and representatives (“advisors”) and those of its Affiliates; provided that such Co-Owner guarantees their adherence to the terms of this Article 8; and provided, further, that prior to making disclosure of Confidential Information to its advisors who are not directors, officers or employees of such Co-Owner or its Affiliates, such Co-Owner shall obtain a written undertaking of confidentiality not less restrictive than that set forth in this Article 8 from each such advisor (except in the case of outside legal counsel, the Co-Owner shall only be required to procure that such legal counsel is bound by a professional legal duty of confidentiality); 8.1.2 to the extent (i) required by any applicable Law, including the rules and regulations of any stock exchange, or (ii) any Co-Owner or any Affiliate thereof or its and their advisors may have received a subpoena or other written demand under color of legal right for such information, such Co-Owner or such Affiliate or advisor may disclose such information; provided that in each case such Co-Owner shall first, as soon as practicable upon becoming aware of such requirement or receipt of such demand, furnish a copy thereof to the other Co-Owners and, if practicable so long as such Co-Owner shall not be in violation of such requirement, subpoena or demand or likely become liable to any penalty or sanctions thereunder, afford the other Co-Owners reasonable opportunity, at any other Co-Owner’s cost and expense, to prevent or limit such disclosure or to obtain a protective order or other reasonably satisfactory assurance of confidential treatment for the information required to be disclosed and reasonably cooperate with the other Co-Owners in connection therewith; and provided, further, that, in any case, such Co-Owner or such Affiliate or advisor shall only disclose that portion of the Confidential Information that, in the opinion of its legal counsel, is required to be disclosed and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to ensure further confidential treatment of the information so disclosed; 8.1.3 to Lenders, potential Lenders or other Persons providing financing to a Co-Owner, a Co-Owner’s Affiliate or a Phase if, prior to disclosure, such Persons have executed an undertaking of confidentiality not less restrictive than that set forth in this Article 8;
